what-to-do-in-lviv.brief: Ukrainian city of Lviv is no doubt one of the most charming and yet not well-known parts of Ukraine.
what-to-do-in-lviv.content: Ukrainian city of Lviv is no doubt one of the most charming and yet not well-known parts of Ukraine. It‚Äôs been recently gaining plenty of attention from the world, and was proudly featured on [BBC](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PkK93bCIofk&list=FLSdbB5_2f0i17sH1Bo-WR9A&index=1&feature=plpp_video) and [EuroNews](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PkK93bCIofk&list=FLSdbB5_2f0i17sH1Bo-WR9A&index=1&feature=plpp_video). City‚Äôs impressive architecture, absense of large tourist crowds and unique combination of rustiness and timelessness bring out a very special charm, capturing the hearts of everyone who‚Äôs ever visited it.  For the perfect vacation in Lviv, check out our extensive compiled selection of top things to do in Lviv!  ## Walk around Rynok Square  UNESCO-listed Rynok Square is one of the top attractions in the city! Your first stop in Lviv will inevitably lead you to the heart of the city ‚Äì Rynok Square, that can be translated as Market Square. For the past 500 years it has been the bustling center of city life and till now retains all the charm of the old European city, without the pretentions of its more famous neighbors ‚Äì Prague and Krakow. **Where to find:** in the very city center, hard to miss! **When to visit:** any time **How much to pay:** for FREE  ## Climb City Town Hall <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/lviv2.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  How about spending 15 min counting up all the steps in Lviv Town Hall? Getting to its top is one of the most fun things to do in Lviv! We won‚Äôt break the secret to you, but will hint that the staircase has more than 300, but less than 500 steps. As they wind up to the tiny round tube at the top of the tower, the counting is even more interesting! **Where to find:** right in the middle of the Market Square (hard to miss!) **When to visit:** Tuesday ‚Äì Friday from 10 am till 5 pm, Saturday ‚Äì Sunday from 11 am till 7 pm. It is closed on Mondays. **How much to pay:** 5 UAH, which is 0.5 EURO  ## Take a photo with Neptun <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/lviv3.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  Even though Lviv Rynok Square has a total of four fountains at each side ‚Äì Diana, Neptune, Adonise and Amphitrite, local Lviv residents give their special love to Neptune. ‚ÄòWhere shall we meet?‚Äô ‚Äì ‚ÄòAt Neptune!‚Äô is a typical phrase in conversations of Lviv university students.  **Where to find:** at the Rynok Square, hard to miss! **When to visit:** anytime of the year **How much to pay:** for FREE  ## Choose your favorite coffee in Svit Kavy <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/lviv4.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  If you are looking for locals‚Äô all-favorite place to sit around and watch the life pass by, go straight to the charming little coffee shop right opposite to the Boim‚Äôs Chapel and Latin Cathedral. Svit Kavy or the World of Coffee is famous for its beautiful interior, lovely summer terrace and, of course, more than 30 varieties of coffee to taste! Deliciously brewed, it will take you to the core of what Lviv is all about. **Where to find:** Katedral‚Äôna Sq. 6, between Amadeus Restaurant and Cafe1.  Svit Kavy also has a souvenir-shop that sells coffee-themed souvenirs and coffee beans; look for it to the left of the caf√©‚Äôs main entrance **When to visit:** Mon ‚Äì Fri: 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Sat, Sun: 9 a.m. ‚Äì 11 p.m. The best time is the end of September during traditional Coffee Festival **How much to pay:** starting from 3 EURO and up  ## Buy handmade chocolate at the Lviv Chocolate Workshop <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/lviv5.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  No one has the heart to pass by this tiny shop and its large glass window, stocked with rows of delicious tempting chocolate.  Right off the Rynok square, it‚Äôs a must visit place for anyone with sweet tooth. Or ‚Äì what the heck ‚Äì simply anyone! While first floor hosts a lovely cafe, the biggest attraction of the place ‚Äì the chocolate shop ‚Äì is up the narrow winding stairs. The shop features plenty of chocolate souvenirs ‚Äì truffles, bars and figures of famous buildings. All the chocolate is handmade, straight from the factory, and packaged in beautiful wrapping. One perfect souvenir from Lviv! **Where to find:** Serbska st., 3 **When to visit:** Anytime of the year, 9 a.m. ‚Äì 23.00. However, best time for chocolate tasting is during city‚Äôs Chocolate Festival (first week of February) **How much to pay:** 5-10 EURO at a coffee shop, 10-15 EURO at the gift shop (credit cards are accepted only at the gift shop)  ## Enjoy performances at Lviv Opera Theater <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/lviv6.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  Much can be written about this most famous Lviv landmark. Known as the Grand Theater originally, it is now formally called The Lviv National Academic Theater of Opera and Ballet of Solomiya Krushelnyts‚Äôka, in honor of Ukraine‚Äôs most well-known female opera singer. The Lviv Opera House was built in 1900 using forms of Renaissance and Baroque architecture. The result is one of the most beautiful opera houses in Europe with a luxurious interior, including the Mirror Hall and Parnassus Curtain and a stunning facade with ornate sculpture work. **Where to find:** Svobody ave., 28 **When to visit:** 11 am ‚Äì 7 pm, tours are available starting from 5 pm. Alternatively, you can buy an entrance ticket and tour around the theater on your own. **How much to pay:** performance tickets cost from 0.5 EURO to 20 EURO, self-guided tour ticket is 1 EURO.  ## Take bird view photos of Lviv from the High Castle hill <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/lviv7.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  Lviv High Castle can be both a major disappointment and biggest surprise to you! Why disappointment? Because despite its promising name, the place is not that high (unless 413 m is impressive for you) and has no castle whatsoever. Why surprise? Because it offers a quiet refuge from the busy city streets, and it has indubitably the best aerial views of the city! The hill, also known as Vysoky Zamok, used to be a wooden fortress, built in the 13th century by King Lev.  **Where to find:** High Castle (Vysokyi Zamok) is located just outside Lviv‚Äôs center inside Vysokyi Zamok Park. There are no direct transport links to the park, so wear good shoes and  enjoy the 15-20-minute walk from the center.  Just follow the small brown signs. **When to visit:** sunny weather is the best for great bird view of the city **How much to pay:** for FREE  ## Explore Lviv underground labyrinths <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/lviv8.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  Would you like to check out the 18th century sarcophagus made from a solid stone? Its cover weighs over 600 kg. The object itself is taken apart, but the nature of wreckage indicates that sarcophagus was broken not from the outside, but ‚Ä¶from the inside! Eerie, isn‚Äôt it? To hear the full Black Monk legend, head to the catacombs of St. Peter and Paul Cathedral of Jesuit Order.   **Where to find:** [Contact](www.activeukraine.com/contact-us/) to arrange for an underground tour of Lviv **When to visit:** any time in the day **How much to pay:** depending on your group size  ## Explore the weaponry collection at Lviv History Museum ‚ÄòArsenal‚Äô <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/lviv9.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  Unquestionably, the biggest attraction for any male traveler in Lviv! Museum boasts thousands of weaponry items from more than 30 countries and as old as 10th century. Knives, daggers, swords, sabers, √©p√©es, yatagans, axes, halberds, maces, czekans, pernaches, and many other strange names of cold, fire and defensive weapons that will keep your interest throughout all the exhibit. The collection‚Äôs highlight is Eastern type sword from the 17th century with double blade, the so-called ‚ÄúZulfakar‚Äù. **Where to find:** Pidvalna st., 5 ‚Äì close to the town center **When to visit:** daily 10:00 ‚Äì 17:30, except Wednesdays **How much to pay:** less than 1 EURO, extra fee is charged for photo and video footage  These and a lot of others impressive things you can do and see in Lviv!!! Try most of them! I bet you will be thrilled!
what-to-do-in-lviv.title: What to do in Lviv

201.description:
Accessibility is not an option; it‚Äôs a must have. Making a website accessible is not one person‚Äôs responsibility, it should be a shared goal. We all work on websites/software with legacy code, shared code, and it‚Äôs not easy to go back to converting a website into an accessible one. In the USA itself, the number of lawsuits filed because a website was inaccessible..has increased a lot in the last 3 years. 
They say, ‚ÄúTake the first step.‚Äù Hear the story of how we took the initiative of making Quizlet accessible by becoming Level A compliant. Quizlet, currently used by over 50 million users per month, provides simple learning tools that let you study anything. Learn what 11 actions we exerted for accessibility, how we overcame the challenges of having a shared code between Android, IOS, and Web, and making Quizlet accessible and inclusive for everyone.
201.title: 11 ways to make your website #a11y compliant

203.description: Do you find yourself repeatedly answering the same questions over-and-over? Why not hand off that part to a bot? Similarly, do you ever find yourself frustrated with a bot and just want to speak to a human? Luckily for web developers, Twilio Autopilot makes this easy! This intelligent bot building platform lets you create intelligent bots that get smarter the more times they are used. You can train each Assistant on different inputs so it can respond to different ways of the same question being asked. When the need arises, it is also easy to stop talking with the bot so a human can respond. In this talk we‚Äôll make a Facebook Messenger bot that does just that and then starts a conversation via SendGrid instead of Facebook Messenger.
203.title: Build a Facebook Messenger Bot with Twilio Autopilot in Node.js

204.description:
As popular web services extend their developer platforms for partners to integrate directly into their interfaces, design trends are forming from experiences in the world of embedded integrations. With Google Drive connecting tools like Balsamiq and ShiftEdit, Gmail enabling Docusign in their web and mobile UI, and Trello‚Äôs PowerUps, custom experiences powered by third parties are proving themselves to be a great way to improve one‚Äôs product and grow your business. 
After analyzing over 10 years of experiments in this space, seeing past failures and current successes, we can identify what works from successful and unsuccessful platforms, what trends are working, and what UX and technical considerations are needed to launch your own successful embedded integration plan.
204.title: Designing Embedded Platforms: Lessons from Industry Success & Failure

206.description:
We want to be able to edit the content ourselves. kthx, 
üíúMarketingüíú 
 
#BigMood üòÖ 
Don‚Äôt dust off that PHP for Dummies book just yet! There is a new tool on the React scene that has been generating a lot of buzz recently. It‚Äôs called GatsbyJS. 
Come learn how Tinder used GatsbyJS to implement our heavy-traffic lifestyle blog. We will also spill the tea on the challenges we faced while using this cutting edge technology. After attending this talk, you too will be able to go back to your epic engineering lives and create a website that non-engineers can edit themselves‚Ä¶ all in React! üí™ 
 
üåàüåàWhat does it all mean!?üåàüåà GatsbyJS is a static-site generator that collects content from a Wordpress CMS, feeds it into a React app, and then turns it into a static website by generating a bunch of static HTML files. 
 - Non-engineering teams are empowered to create fabulous content without engineers. 
 - Engineering teams are empowered to code in familiar programming languages. 
 - Users can breeze through the website ‚Äì it‚Äôs static. No real-time API calls. Automagically optimized images. Speedy load-times. üöÄ 
 - Boss gives everyone raises. 
 
Bring your humor, forget the PHP, & let‚Äôs have some nerdy fun together!
206.title: A Tinder Love Story: How we created our WordPress blog in React instead of PHP

301.description: Have you always wondered how to build machine learning models using TensorFlow to solve real-world problems? Well, in this talk, Aaron will cover the basics of Machine Learning and walk you through step-by-step on how to use TensorFlow to build powerful ML models to solve real-world problems. Some of the problems we‚Äôll solve are Cartpole, and a tennis-playing agent! You can follow him on Twitter @aaronhma.
301.title: Machine Learning for Everyone

302.description:
Did you ever wonder if you could train/evaluate/run/reuse models on your browser or with node.js? 
Tensorflow.js unlocks multiple possibilities for us. * Machine Learning and Deep Learning on the browser or in the backend with node.js * WebGL acceleration out of the box. * Our models run on the client for better privacy and lower latency. * Flexibility and consistency with popular Python libraries reusing models trained by those. 
In this talk, we‚Äôll see what Artificial Intelligence is and where does Tensorflow.js fit in it. Also, we‚Äôll implement Linear Regression with JavaScript and introduce some Tensorflow.js concepts. Lastly, we‚Äôll extend our simple model to use multiple dimensions by predicting house values from a set of features. Lastly, we‚Äôll check out Transfer Learning by creating our own image recognition login system. 
By going over some interesting demos we won‚Äôt only get accustomed to some Machine Learning concepts but also learn Tensorflow.js at the same time.
302.title: Diving into Tensorflow.js

303.description: Swift for TensorFlow is an open-source, cross-platform machine learning framework built on top of TensorFlow. In this session, you will learn what features have recently been added to S4TF v0.4 and what the engineering team has planned for the upcoming months. We will also discuss why Swift is uniquely positioned to offer a production deployment solution for machine learning projects.
303.title: Swift for TensorFlow

307.description:
We‚Äôll explore lots of different facets of neural networks in this post, including how to setup a basic neural network (including choosing the number of hidden layers, hidden neurons, batch sizes etc.) We‚Äôll learn about the role momentum and learning rates play in influencing model performance. And finally we‚Äôll explore the problem of vanishing gradients and how to tackle it using non-saturating activation functions, BatchNorm, better weight initialization techniques and early stopping. 
Training neural networks can be very confusing! The sheer size of customizations that they offer can be overwhelming to even seasoned practitioners. In this talk I‚Äôll give you a framework for making smart decisions about your neural network architecture! I hope this guide will serve as a good starting point in your adventures.
307.title: Designing Your Neural Networks: A Step By Step Walkthrough

401.description:
In this talk you will hear the story of how a chain of pet clinics started their journey from a legacy system to a container-based and serverless system on Google Cloud Platform, the code they wrote, and the benefits they reaped. You will also learn how you can embark on that journey with your organization, and achieve safer deployments and lower cost if you already have. 
As developers we used to have to choose between: + Containers: move software from developers‚Äô machines to the cloud with confidence. + Serverless: only pay for the computing you actually use. 
Come and see how to achieve both!
401.title: Serverless Containers - a match made in heaven

402.description: Kubernetes is the most important container orchestrator. Many job postings require this new skill. However, it is not easy to begin and learn it. This talk will show and demo some FUN and EASY ways to pick up this new and important skills developed by Google ! We will use GCP, qwiklabs to demo.
402.title: How to learn Kubernetes the Fun and Easy way!

404.description: There are more ways now than ever to build for Google Assistant and figuring out the right approach for you is crucial. In this talk, we‚Äôll start with changes in user‚Äôs behaviors that Google has seen via user studies and market research; then we‚Äôll go over different ways you can build.
404.title: Ways to build for Google Assistant

405.description: Everyone loves a good spooky story! (Or is cowering under their bed sheets‚Ä¶ Either/or‚Ä¶) And what better to captivate the audience than letting them choose their own scare? We all can‚Äôt be in the same illustrious class of penmen as R.L. Stine, but we can create compelling experiences with tools such as Typeform! Code doesn‚Äôt always tell a compelling story, but conversational UIs developer with easy to use logic jumps can help you craft your own interactive adventure. See how to use the Typeform to give your conversational UIs a voice on the Google Assistant with Dialogflow. Now you can spread your stories reach to more than 500 million devices, including smart speakers, phones, cars, TVs, headphones, watches, and more.
405.title: Reader Beware, Choose Your Own Scare...

406.description: Build what‚Äôs next together - whether you are a developer or not. Google Cloud has given business users and knowledge workers to build enterprise custom applications to simplify processes and solve business problems. G-Suite in particular has enabled these ‚Äúnon-coders‚Äù to build powerful solutions in Sheets, Forms and App Maker. In this session, I will demonstrate how easy it is to develop using G-Suite with very little code, and then how we can build on that by integrating with Google Cloud Platform libraries and services. Finally, I will discuss how experienced coders can empower these knowledge workers to develop solutions quicker and better.
406.title: Empowering Business Users & Knowledge Workers with Google Cloud

riya_dashoriya.bio: Riya Dashoriya is a Software Engineer at Quizlet, San Francisco. Riya has veritable curiosity and passion to dig into things and find out how they work. Her current favorites are Diversity & Inclusion, Communities, React, Accessibility and Actions on Google Assistant.

lizzie_siegle.bio: Lizzie serves developers in the Bay Area and beyond on Twilio‚Äôs developer evangelism team and holds a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science from Bryn Mawr. She likes Swift, JavaScript, and working with AI, but has been seen writing Python and Haskell as well. When not organizing or attending hackathons and meetups, she enjoys tennis, ping pong, and all things Disney.
lizzie_siegle.name: Lizzie  Siegle

jeremy_glassenberg.bio:
Jeremy is an experienced Product leader of over 11 years with a proven track record of building and monetizing platforms such as Box. He has managed and expanded developer platforms to communities of tens of thousands of developers, executed on high profile integrations promoted by Salesforce and Google, and established key components in paths to monetization. While focused on Product, Jeremy has managed and grown several successful developer communities and Developer Relations teams. 
Jeremy is a mentor to top-tier startup accelerators such as Alchemist and Techstars, and advises developer-focused startups such as Moesif (API intelligence) and OpenChannel.io (framework for app marketplaces). 
He is currently the VP Platform at Pinn.ai
jeremy_glassenberg.name: Jeremy Glassenberg

lavanya_shukla.bio: Lavanya is a machine learning engineer @ Weights and Biases. She began working on AI 10 years ago when she founded ACM SIGAI at Purdue University as a sophomore. In a past life, she taught herself to code at age 10, and built her first startup at 14. She‚Äôs driven by a deep desire to understand the universe around us better by using machine learning.

cleo_espiritu.bio: Cleo Espiritu is a Google Developer Expert for G-Suite. She holds an MSc in computing science from the University of Alberta, and has experience working in various roles, such as user experience designer, software developer, business analyst, and system designer. Her passion for designing and developing software that improves end-users‚Äô lives led her to champion and educate on the use of G-Suite for people to transform the way they work. She is currently a Product Manager at ATB Financial.

He has been writing code for five years and has found his love in Angular, Firebase, Progressive Web Apps, and the voodoo ways of the web‚Ä¶ Michael has also spoken at various meetups and conferences, including Angular NYC, Techduels, and the United Nations. Michael‚Äôs dream side project is a MaaS (Memes as a Service) platform for meme delivery by mail.

martin_omander.bio: Martin Omander works for Google in Mountain View, California. His job in the Developer Relations team is to help developers build better software, and improve Google‚Äôs Cloud Platform to make it even better for that purpose. In his spare time he manages to sneak in some game programming. Before Google, Martin worked at string of startups in Silicon Valley as a software engineer.

paige_bailey.bio:
Paige Bailey is the product manager for Swift for TensorFlow and TensorFlow‚Äôs core Python APIs. 
Prior to her role as a PM in Google‚Äôs Research and Machine Intelligence org, Paige was developer advocate for TensorFlow core; a senior software engineer and machine learning engineer in the office of the Microsoft Azure CTO; and a data scientist at Chevron. Her academic research was focused on lunar ultraviolet, at the Laboratory for Atmospheric and Space Physics (LASP) in Boulder, CO, as well as Southwest Research Institute (SwRI) in San Antonio, TX.
paige_bailey.name: Paige Bailey
paige_bailey.shortBio:
Paige Bailey is the product manager for Swift for TensorFlow and TensorFlow‚Äôs core Python APIs. 
Prior to her role as a PM in Google‚Äôs Research and Machine Intelligence org, Paige was developer advocate for TensorFlow core; a senior software engineer and machine learning engineer in the office of the Microsoft Azure CTO; and a data scientist at Chevron. Her academic research was focused on lunar ultraviolet, at the Laboratory for Atmospheric and Space Physics (LASP) in Boulder, CO, as well as Southwest Research Institute (SwRI) in San Antonio, TX.
paige_bailey.title: Product Manager

jessica_earley_cha.bio: Jessica Dene Earley-Cha is a Developer Advocate for Google Assistant. She loves to connect with developers and explore VUI (voice user interface) to add another dimension to how user interact with technology. Jessica is part of the leadership team for WomenInVoice@. You‚Äôll find her either spending time with her dog, collecting strawberry knick knack or biking around town.
